Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an unnecessary use of taxpayer money to support an already bloated government.
The proposal is viewed as an infringement on free speech rights under the constitution.
The responsibility of determining misinformation or disinformation should not lie with unelected bureaucrats who may have vested interests.
The focus should be on educating the public to think critically rather than controlling information.
Notable Quotes: I DO NOT want my taxes being used to implement this Orwellian policy and pay for its upkeep.
Nobody has the right, under the constitution, to restrict free speech.
You should be educating the public on how to think critically, rather than brainwashing and propagandizing.
